bits.name: combineTicks
bits.description: Use combined rear wheel-ticks instead of the single tick

bits.name: useWtSpeed
bits.description: Use speed measurements (data type 11 in ESF-MEAS) instead of single ticks (data type 10)

bits.name: dirPinPol
bits.description: Direction pin polarity. 0: High signal level means forward direction, 1: High signal level means backward direction.

bits.name: useWtPin
bits.description: Use wheel-tick pin for speed measurement.

bits.name: autoWtCountMaxOff
bits.description: Disable automatic estimation of maximum absolute wheel-tick counter value (0: enabled, 1: disabled).

bits.name: autoDirPinPolOff
bits.description: Disable automatic wheel-tick direction pin polarity detection (0: enabled, 1: disabled).

bits.name: autoSoftwareWtOff
bits.description: Disable automatic use of wheel-tick or speed data received over the software interface if available (0: enabled, 1: disabled).

bits.name: autoUseWtSpeedOff
bits.description: Disable automatic receiver reconfiguration for processing speed data instead of wheel-tick data if no wheel-tick data are available but speed data were detected (0: enabled, 1: disabled).

fields.name: wtFactor
fields.description: Wheel-tick scale factor to obtain distance [m] from wheel-ticks (0 = not set)

fields.name: wtQuantError
fields.description: Wheel-tick quantization. If useWtSpeed is set then this is interpreted as the speed measurement error RMS.

fields.name: wtCountMax
fields.description: Wheel-tick counter maximum value (rollover - 1). If null, relative wheel-tick counts are assumed.

fields.name: wtLatency
fields.description: Wheel-tick data latency due to e.g. CAN bus

fields.name: wtFrequency
fields.description: Nominal wheel-tick data frequency (0 = not set)

bits.name: cntBothEdges
bits.description: Count both rising and falling edges on wheel-tick signal.

fields.name: speedDeadBand
fields.description: Speed sensor dead band (0 = not set)

adjudication.reasoning: The single extraction provided is consistent with the u-blox M8 protocol specification for UBX-CFG-ESFWT. The byte offsets align correctly (total 32 bytes), bitfield definitions for flags1/2/3 match the documentation, and data types/scalings are standard for this message.
